business.headline: How Trump tariffs could make iPhones, cars, and clothes costlier in the USTrump's latest plan includes a massive 145% tax on goods coming from China. Experts say this could end the long run of cheap, imported goods that Americans have enjoyed for decades.
Sensex ends 1,300 points higher, Nifty above 22,500; Tata Steel up 5%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,310.11 points to close at 75,157.26, while the NSE Nifty50 added 429.40 points to end at 22,828.55.

Mutual fund SIP vs PPF: What Rs 1 lakh a year can earn in 15 yearsPPF is a government scheme with a current interest rate of around 7.1% per annum. On the other hand, SIPs typically offer higher interest when invested over the long term, especially in equity mutual funds. But they carry some risk, as returns depend on the market.

Explained: Why Muthoot Finance shares fell over 8% todayMuthoot Finance stock price: Muthoot Finance, one of India's largest gold loan companies, has seen its share price decline by 14% in the past five trading sessions. The stock is also down 7% over the past month.

Mutual fund inflows hit in March. Trump tariffs to blame?The largest outflows were seen in debt mutual funds, where investors pulled out Rs 2.02 lakh crore, possibly due to end-of-year financial needs by institutions and ongoing global uncertainty.

Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath's money advice: 'No shortcuts to getting rich'Nithin Kamath shared a video with a powerful message—earning more doesn't mean you're saving more. In fact, higher income often leads to more spending on gadgets, clothes, dining out, or things meant just to impress others.

Trump tariffs, trade war fears could bring your loan EMIs down further this yearBorrowers could emerge as the unexpected winners if global headwinds linger and domestic growth slows further, with the RBI likely to step in again to lower the key interest rates.

Wall Street crashes, Dalal Street rallies: 5 things investors should knowStock market today: Dalal Street's leading indices rallied sharply, defying a global sell-off sparked by Wall Street's overnight crash. Here are the key factors behind today's stock market rally.

Mutual fund inflows fall for March by Rs 4,221 crore, shows AMFI dataEquity mutual fund inflows dropped by Rs 4,221 crore in March, falling to Rs 25,082 crore from Rs 29,303 crore in February 2025, as per data released by the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI).

TCS shares fall after disappointing Q4. Check latest price targetsTCS share price: Despite a muted Q4, brokerages back TCS with revised targets, betting on deal wins, margin levers, and recovery prospects to drive medium-term gains.

Sensex jumps 1,400 points: 3 things to know about Dalal Street rallyShare market today: A surprise rally may have lit up the screens, but with volatility still lurking and trade risks unresolved, investors would do well to tread carefully through this temporary pocket of optimism.

Sensex up by 1,300 points, Nifty above 22,500 as markets cheer tariff pauseStock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex surged 1,353.59 points to 75,200.74, while the NSE Nifty 50 gained 443.70 points to 22,842.85 as of 9:43 am.

entertainment.headline: Viral: Superstar Rajinikanth arrives in Kerala for Jailer 2 shootSuperstar Rajinikanth arrived in Kerala's Attappadi to take part in the shooting of 'Jailer 2'. Directed by Nelson Dilipkumar, the current shooting schedule is expected to go on for about 20 days.

Priyanka Chopra reunites with Hrithik Roshan for Krrish 4: ReportPriyanka Chopra is reportedly believed to have joined forces with Hrithik Roshan again for Krrish 4. The next part of the franchise will be directed by Hrithik.

Nushrratt Bharuccha meets PM Modi, thanks him for rescuing her from IsraelNushrratt Bharuccha shared a post and thanked Prime Minister Narendra Modi for bringing her back from war-torn Israel during the recent conflicts. This comes after the actor met PM Modi at a recent event.

I'm just an actor: Akshay Kumar reacts to political row over Sankaran NairAkshay Kumar distanced himself from political comments linked to his upcoming film 'Kesari 2' in which he portarys a pre-Independence president of the Indian National Congress.

Akshay Kumar reacts to Jaya Bachchan's criticism of Toilet: Ek Prem KathaAkshay Kumar addressed Jaya Bachchan's criticism of his film 'Toilet: Ek Prem Katha' during 'Kesari 2' trailer launch, stating that if she believes the title is inappropriate, she must be right.

Empuraan box office: Mohanlal, Prithviraj's film storms past Rs 100 crore in IndiaMohanlal and Prithviraj Sukumaran's L2: Empuraan zoomed past Rs 100 crore at the domestic box office. On Day 15, the film witnessed a decline, earning only Rs 0.70 crore.

Sushmita Sen's sister-in-law Charu leaves Mumbai, is now selling clothes onlineSushmita Sen's ex sister-in-law, Charu Asopa, leaves Mumbai after facing a financial crisis. The actor even sold off her clothes online for extra money.

Indian, not pan-Indian: Sunny Deol on evolution of Indian cinemaJaat star Sunny Deol has been busy promoting his new film. During a recent media event, the actor spoke about the growing trend of pan-Indian films.

Emraan Hashmi on his son's cancer diagnosis: My entire world flipped in 12 hoursActor Emraan Hashmi recounted the harrowing day his son, Ayaan, was diagnosed with cancer. The life-changing event occurred unexpectedly during a family brunch in 2014.
Emraan Hashmi on singer KK: No substitute for certain talentActor Emraan Hashmi recently remembered the late singer KK and said that his voice was godsent. KK died in May in 2022.

Sunny Deol's Jaat is a parody of all his hit movies...and himselfSunny Deol returns to the big screen with 'Jaat', a film echoing the style of classic B-grade cinema. Packed with action and nostalgia, the film aims to capture the essence of a bygone era.

Mobland star Mandeep Dhillon 'would love to see Shah Rukh Khan in Guy Ritchie film'Mobland star Mandeep Dhillon expressed her desire to see Shah Rukh Khan in a Guy Ritchie film, as she shared her Bollywood obsession during an interview. Anson Boon, her co-star, is equally excited about the idea and ready to explore Indian cinema while working on Ritchie's spontaneous and thrilling sets.

Trisha shares cryptic post about online toxicity, calls it 'anonymous cowardice'Actor Trisha Krishnan shared a cryptic post on Friday hinting at the toxicity on social media. She is currently seen in Good Bad Ugly, starring Ajith Kumar.

Rajamouli 'thrilled' at RRR's mention as Oscars adds Best Stunt Design categoryFilmmaker SS Rajamouli was thrilled after The Academy gave his film 'RRR' an honorary mention as it introduced Best Stunt Design category. The Academy included 'RRR', 'Mission Impossible' and 'Everything Everywhere All at Once' in the announcement poster.

Gippy Grewal's Akaal faces backlash for alleged misrepresentation of Sikh CommunityThe latest Punjabi film Akaal is in troubled waters after Sikh leader Baba Bakshish Singh condemned it for hurting Sikh sentiments. It stars Gippy Grewal, Nimrat Khaira and Nikitin Dheer.

Chhorii 2 review: Nushrratt-Soha's film fights social evils but where's the scare?Released-Fri Apr 11, 2025The much-anticipated sequel 'Chhorii 2' promised to blend horror with social issues but left audiences wanting more. The film struggles to deliver the intended chills, leading to a lacklustre experience.
Grey's Anatomy actor Eric Dane, 52, diagnosed with ALSActor Eric Dane has announced his ALS diagnosis in a statement to PEOPLE, expressing gratitude for his family's support.

Actor Nitanshi Goel halts ramp walk, touches Hema Malini's feet, hugs Sushmita SenIn a touching moment at a Mumbai fashion show, Laapataa Ladies actor Nitanshi Goel paused her ramp walk to pay respects to veteran actor Hema Malini. Additionally, she also hugged Sushmita Sen, who was also present at the event with her model Rohman Shawl.

Jaat box office Day 1: Sunny Deol, Randeep Hooda film off to a decent startSunny Deol is back with 'Jaat', following the massive success of 'Gadar 2'. The film opened with moderate earnings, marking a stark contrast to his previous blockbuster.

general news.headline: Nainar Nagendran will be new Tamil Nadu BJP chief, K Annamalai proposed his nameBJP MLA Nainar Nagendran is set to take charge as the Tamil Nadu BJP state president. His name was suggested by the outgoing chief K Annamalai.

China hits back with 125% tariffs on US goods, will 'ignore' any more Trump leviesTrade tensions soared as China raised tariffs on US goods to 125%, hours after Donald Trump hiked duties on Chinese imports to 145%, excluding Beijing from a broader tariff pause.

Tahawwur Rana linked to 26/11-style plots across cities, NIA told Delhi courtThe anti-terror agency made the claim before special judge Chander Jit Singh, who remanded 26/11 plotter Tahawwur Rana to 18-day NIA custody.

India's first extradition battle: When a daughter forgave her father's killerIndia's first extradition battle to get custody of Khalistani separatist Ranjit Singh 'Kuki' Gill lasted 12 years. Gill was among the three who killed Congress MP Lalit Maken, his wife and bodyguard in Delhi in 1985. Gill, extradited in 2000, walked free in 2009, after their daughter, Avantika Maken, forgave him for the murders.

Vanishing daughters: Haryana forms task force, 300 abortion centres lose licenceThe string of actions comes after an investigation by India Today flagged a booming female foeticide racket in Haryana, which has seen a decline in the state's sex ratio at birth.

DMK minister removed from party post for vulgar comparisons of Hindu tilaksTamil Nadu minister K Ponmudi made a vulgar joke in a public forum, which compared Hindu 'tilaks' with sexual positions. The comment sparked outrage, with even party leader Kanimozhi condemning the remark. The DMK removed him as deputy general secretary.

Unilateral bullying, says Xi Jinping in 1st reaction to US's 145% tariffMeeting with Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez in Beijing, Xi Jinping stressed the need for deeper cooperation between China and the EU amid the growing trade war with Washington.
We finally know how Isro is planning to land Mangalyaan-2 on MarsThe details were shared by Isro chief Dr V Narayanan during an address at the Navaratna Conference.

Tahawwur Rana questioned by NIA, focus on Headley's India contact, Pak links Live UpdatesWith Tahawwur Rana securely in its custody, the NIA is questioning the 26/11 plotter about his involvement in the conspiracy to commit terrorist acts alongside notorious figures such as David Headley.

Wearing burqa and sitting with Hindu?: Girl, classmate assaulted in BengaluruA Hindu boy and his Muslim classmate were allegedly subjected to moral policing by five young men in Bengaluru. The group allegedly tried to assault the boy and filmed the duo.

Think a few drinks a week are safe? Your brain is quietly paying the priceA study revealed that people who drink heavily are more likely to develop brain lesions and neurodegenerative changes, both of which are strongly linked to dementia.
Grey's Anatomy actor Eric Dane, 52, diagnosed with ALSActor Eric Dane has announced his ALS diagnosis in a statement to PEOPLE, expressing gratitude for his family's support.

Attackers deserve Pak's highest honour, Tahawwur Rana told David Headley: USIn an official statement on Tahawwur Rana's extradition to India, the US Department of Justice disclosed fresh details about the former Pakistan army officer and his links to David Headley.

Is 26/11 plotter David Coleman Headley a double agent shielded by US?India has taken 26/11 terror-attack conspirator Tahawwur Rana into its custody. Though the US has extradited Rana, it seems to be dragging its feet on the extradition of key plotter David Coleman Headley, a bigger fish. Is Headley a double agent who the US is not ready to hand over to India?

Who was Agustin Escobar, Siemens Spain CEO who was killed in Hudson chopper crash?A private helicopter carrying Siemens Spain CEO Agustin Escobar and his family crashed into the Hudson River, killing all six aboard, including three children. Authorities have cited mid-air structural failure.

Bengaluru becoming unaffordable, eating into our savings: Man's LinkedIn post is viralA Bengaluru resident highlighted the fact that from rent and milk to metro fares and fuel, costs in India's tech capital are increasing across the board while salaries remain stagnant.

Big leadership announcement expected following Amit Shah's Tamil Nadu visit?Amid leadership speculation, Tamil Nadu BJP braces for major changes following Union Home Minister Amit Shah's visit, with Annamalai's future uncertain and AIADMK potentially gaining a larger role in the NDA alliance.
This electric car is fastest to reach 20,000 sales. Not any Hyundai, Tata modelAvailable in three variants, this electric vehicle (EV) is priced between Rs 13,99,800 and Rs 15,99,800 (ex-showroom).

Was scheduled to stay at Taj on 26/11 night: Himanta Sarma recalls close shaveAssam Chief Minister Himanta Sarma said on the night of the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks, he was scheduled to stay at the Taj Hotel but destiny had other plans.

He urged supporters to stay behind the team despite domestic struggles and Europa League uncertainties.

India among list of countries bidding to host AFC Asian Cup 2031India have officially submitted a bid to host the 2031 AFC Asian Cup, aiming to bring a major football tournament back to the country for the first time since the 2017 FIFA U-17 World Cup.

CSK vs KKR Live: Captain Dhoni returns to lead the Kings against KnightsChennai Super Kings (CSK) vs Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) Live Score, IPL 2025: MS Dhoni's return as CSK captain has only added an additional jolt of surprise and excitement to IPL 2025, and his first challenge comes up against a familiar rival KKR.

Salah signs contract extension with Liverpool after months of exit rumoursMarking an end to months of intense exit rumours, Mohamed Salah has penned a contract extension that will keep him at Liverpool beyond the 2024-2025 season.

DC star KL Rahul happy to use home comforts to torment RCB again in BengaluruDelhi Capitals star KL Rahul said he knows about the Chinnaswamy stadium more than anyone else as he tormented Royal Challengers Bengaluru once again. Rahul was the match-winner as DC continued their unbeaten run.

Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.

NFL: T.J. Watt's Steelers future in question as contract nears endThe Pittsburgh Steelers have built their legacy on a dominant defense, and T.J. Watt has been the face of that tradition. But as a pivotal season approaches, uncertainty looms.

KL Rahul haunts RCB again in Bengaluru as DC continue unbeaten runLocal boy KL Rahul came back to haunt his former side RCB with a stunning performance as DC maintained their unbeaten run in the IPL 2025 season. RCB were left to rue on the bright start they made as Delhi came back into the contest with their impressive bowling.

MS Dhoni had no hesitation to step in as captain: CSK head coachChennai Super Kings (CSK) head coach Stephen Fleming revealed that legendary wicketkeeper batter MS Dhoni understood the team's situation and had no hesitation to step in as captain after Rututaj Gaikwad got ruled out of the entire Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) due to an elbow injury.

61 for 0 to 163/7: Kuleep, Vipraj's spin magic choke RCB after fiery startDelhi Capitals (DC) made a remarkable comeback with the ball against Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) in Match 24 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) as they restricted them to 163 despite a fiery start in the powerplay.

Virat Kohli slammed by fans after Phil Salt's run out in RCB vs DC: SelfishVirat Kohli was slammed by the fans for his involvement in the run out of Phil Salt during the RCB vs DC clash on Thursday, April 10. Salt was in fine form before being run out.

MS Dhoni as Chennai Super Kings captain is a different beast: Sourav GangulyFormer India captain Sourav Ganguly has made a big statement on MS Dhoni, saying that he's a different beast altogether as the captain of Chennai Super Kings (CSK).

The Masters 2025: Scheffler eyes third green jacket, Rory seeks his firstThe 89th edition of The Masters teed off Thursday with its largest field in a decade and two players firmly in the spotlight: Scottie Scheffler and Rory McIlroy.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
